title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
description: A groundbreaking exploration of how our minds work, revealing the two systems that drive the way we think and make decisions.
author: Daniel Kahneman

title: The Great Gatsby
description: A classic novel that explores themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream in the Jazz Age.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

title: Influence: The Psychology of Persuasion
description: An essential read on the principles of persuasion and how they affect our everyday decisions and interactions.
author: Robert B. Cialdini

description: A dystopian novel that depicts a totalitarian society under the surveillance of Big Brother and explores themes of censorship and freedom.
author: George Orwell

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
description: A compelling overview of human history and how Homo sapiens came to dominate the Earth.
author: Yuval Noah Harari

title: The Shining
description: A psychological horror story about a family that moves into an isolated hotel with a dark, violent past, leading to a chilling descent into madness.
author: Stephen King

title: Dracula
description: A tale of dark romance and supernatural horror following Count Dracula’s journey from Transylvania to England as he seeks to spread his undead curse.
author: Bram Stoker

title: Moby-Dick
description: The epic sea adventure of Captain Ahab, who obsessively hunts the white whale that maimed him, symbolizing humanity's struggle against nature.
author: Herman Melville

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
description: A classic American novel that follows the journey of a young boy and a runaway slave as they navigate the Mississippi River and face moral dilemmas.
author: Mark Twain

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A novel of manners that follows Elizabeth Bennet as she navigates societal expectations and romantic entanglements with Mr. Darcy.
author: Jane Austen

title: The Art of War
description: A classic work on military strategy and tactics.
author: Sun Tzu

title: The Call of Cthulhu
description: A short story that introduces the cosmic horror of Cthulhu, a god-like creature that lies dormant beneath the sea.
author: H.P. Lovecraft

title: The Road
description: A harrowing post-apocalyptic tale that follows a father and son as they struggle to survive in a bleak, barren world.
author: Cormac McCarthy

title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
description: A classic adventure novel by Jules Verne that follows a group of explorers as they embark on an expedition to discover a hidden world beneath the Earth's surface.
author: Jules Verne

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
description: A story of betrayal, revenge, and redemption, following the life of Edmond Dantès who is wrongfully imprisoned and seeks vengeance.
author: Alexandre Dumas

title: Treasure Island
description: The adventurous tale of young Jim Hawkins, who discovers a pirate's map and sets out on a dangerous voyage in search of buried treasure.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

title: Frankenstein
description: The story of Victor Frankenstein, a young scientist who creates a sentient being, leading to tragic consequences.
author: Mary Shelley

title: The Wealthy Gardener
description: An inspiring tale about achieving financial success and living a fulfilling life, blending business principles and life lessons.
author: John Soforic

title: The Odyssey
description: An epic adventure that follows Odysseus's long journey home after the Trojan War, encountering various mythical creatures and divine beings.
author: Homer

title: The Power of Habit
description: An exploration of the science behind habit formation and how we can harness the power of habits to create positive change.
author: Charles Duhigg
